meanings.definition: To cut through something with a sharp tool or instrument.
meanings.sent1: She used the scissors to shearwater through the paper.
meanings.sent2: The chef needed to shearwater the vegetables quickly for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: He shearwatered through the dense forest with his machete.
meanings.sent4: The sharp knife could shearwater through the tough meat effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The barber had to shearwater through the thick hair with precision.
